The administrator must configure each required option to successfully integrate the Sales Analytics template for use in Dynamics 365 Sales.

You need to identify which option to select.

Which option should you use? To answer, select the appropriate option in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct...just did the exercise yesterday. OAuth2 and Organization level
I would go for C. I tried it in my environment. One can create one more order from Won status of Quote.

Selected Answer: C
If the quote is in a "Won" status, the salesperson can create a new order from the quote without revising it. This is because when a quote is "Won", it is locked and cannot be modified, but it can still be used to create orders. (C option)

However, if the quote is in a "Closed" status (other than "Won"), the salesperson would need to revise the quote before creating a new order from it. (B option)

comments.content: Had another look - I think C

questions.question_text:
A quote is accepted by a customer. A salesperson creates an order from the quote. The customer contacts the salesperson to request a repeat of the same order.

The salesperson wants to create another order from the same quote.

You need to create the order.

What should you do?

choices.A: Create the order from the quote because it is in a Closed status.
choices.B: Revise the quote and create the order from Draft status.
choices.D: Revise the quote and create the order from the Active status.
choices.C: Create the order from the quote because it is in a Won status.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.

A user cannot find the option to view activities in the Kanban view or rearrange the activities.

You need to make the Kanban view available to the user.

What should you do?

choices.C: Add the control to the Activity table.
choices.A: Add the user to the correct security role.
choices.D: Instruct the user to create a personal view.

comments.content: I would say C. In the learn document it specifies that Kaban is available for any primary sales role. We can assume that in the sales environment user will be a Sales person or Sales Manager role, therefore the control for the Activity is not activated.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. Add the user to the correct security role. By adding the user to the appropriate security role, the user will have access to the system view that includes the Kanban view for activities.

Creating a new system view or adding a control to the Activity table would not necessarily make the Kanban view available to the user. Instructing the user to create a personal view may not be a viable solution if the user needs access to the standard Kanban view for activities.

Selected Answer: C
i think c

It should be A , In the question it is clearly mentioned that it is for a User not Users.

The Read only grid is default option, so when users select opportunities from the site map, they see a read only grid. To make Kanban view the default one - select radio control option

Selected Answer: C
If the Kanban control is added to the entity, it is available for any primary sales role, like sales manager, sales person, etc.

Selected Answer: C
Control needs to be added to the Activity entity
